verses.roman:
tataḥ pravavṛte yuddhaṁ
śālvānāṁ yadubhiḥ saha
yathāsurāṇāṁ vibudhais
tumulaṁ loma-harṣaṇam

synonyms: tataḥ—then; pravavṛte—began; yuddham—a battle; śālvānām—of the followers of Śālva; yadubhiḥ saha—with the Yadus; yathā—just like; asurāṇām—of the demons; vibudhaiḥ—with the demigods; tumulam—tumultuous; loma-harṣaṇam—making bodily hair stand on end.
translation: A tumultuous, hair-raising battle then commenced between Śālva's forces and the Yadus. It equaled the great battles between the demons and demigods.
